title: Uzbekistan - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: On 3 February 2021, workers and owner of the brick manufacturing plant in Uchtepa district of Tashkent city gathered on the premises in protest of the upcoming shutdown of plant operation due to land property dispute involving the local administration, calling for the country's president and government to intervene and save their plant and jobs. [size=no report]

On 2 February 2021, personnel of the Nukus district hospital gathered outside the medical facility near the town of Akmangit of Karakalpakstan region, demanding extra pay for their service during coronavirus quarantine. [size=no report]

On 1 February 2021, residents of the 2-microdistrict in Andizhan city protested outside their homes against illegal construction activity in their backyard, demanding the authorities stop the project. [size=no report]

On 1 February 2021, taxi drivers protested in Nukus city against the inaction of the local Department of Transportation toward unlicensed cab operators demanding the authorities regulate unregistered livery activity in the city. [size=no report]

On 31 January 2021, dozens of workers of the Jizzakh Petroleum oil refinery in the town of Tinchlik in Altyariq district of Fergana region protested outside the plant against mass lay-offs and low wages demanding the company preserve local jobs. [size=dozens]

On 30 January 2021, residents of the Kyzketken neighborhood in Nukus city gathered on Moynaq street demanding the city authorities fix the local rundown infrastructure and resolve their concerns regarding the illegal construction of residential properties in the area. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2021, residents of the Central-6 neighborhood in Yunusabad district of Tashkent city protested outside their homes against the Tower Build company's project in their backyard, demanding to stop the construction activity which protesters argued was illegal. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2021, residents of the local neighborhood near Yashnobod locality in Mirzo Ulugbek district of Tashkent city protested against the construction of a bank at the local park demanding the city authorities preserve trees in the area. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2021, residents of Karshi township in Kashkadarya region protested outside the local administration demanding a meeting with a Mayor following lack of power and natural gas supply to their homes. [size=no report]

On 27 January 2021, an anti-police protest took place in the village of Chorshanbe in Shahrisabz district of Kashkadarya region after two police officers fined car drivers for illegal parking. The drivers started to protest against the police actions. Later on, the local residents also joined the protest. [size=no report]

On 26 January 2021, residents of Bukhara city gathered outside the city prosecutor's office demanding their complaints assessed by the law enforcement agency. Protesters alleged the prosecutor's office had ignored their cases. [size=no report]

Around 24 January 2021, residents of the Begubor neighbourhood in Yunusabad district of Tashkent city gathered outside their homes accusing district officials of corruption and demanding the city authorities stop the construction project in their backyard. [size=no report]

On 24 January 2021, residents of the neighbourhood gathered at the nearby park of Mother and child in Yashnobod locality of Mirzo Ulugbek district in Tashkent city in protest of the city administration's decision to remove trees in the park for construction of a bank on location. Protesters demanded city officials preserve trees. [size=no report]

On 23 January 2021, protesters blocked access to the site of a planned demolition of the local grocery shop in Yunusabad district of Tashkent city demanding removal of the construction equipment from the location. [size=no report]

On 22 January 2021, employees of the Karakalpakstan regional prosecutor's office gathered outside headquarters in Nukus city demanding owed wages for work since September and October 2020. [size=no report]

On 21 January 2021, residents of the Shaykhantokhur neighbourhood near Uchtepa locality in Shaykhantokhur district of Tashkent city protested against an attempt by a construction company to build a commercial housing in their backyard demanding the local authorities shut it down. District official promised to close it upon meeting with protesters at the location. [size=no report]

On 20 January 2021, dozens of auto scheme victims gathered on Mustakillik square in Tashkent city demanding the Uzbek authorities assist protesters with the recovery of their funds from a car selling company or delivery of their automobiles for which they paid for. [size=dozens]

On 20 January 2021, homeowners protested outside their demolished homes at the construction site in Andizhan city demanding the developer company provide proper compensation for temporary relocation or deliver their new housing on time which developer failed to provide on-time, protesters complained. [size=no report]
Around 19 January 2021, residents of Durmoncha village in Bagdad district of Fergana region gathered near their homes calling for the authorities to provide access to drinking water. [size=no report]

On 19 January 2021, residents of Chalysh township in Urgench district of Khorezm region blocked the Chalysh-Urgench motor road to protest the lack of natural gas and electricity supply in their neighbourhoods, demanding the local authorities resolve the issues with utility supply. [size=no report]

On 19 January 2021, residents of the apartment buildings 13 and 14 in Labzak neighbourhood of Shaykhantokhur district in Tashkent city protested in their backyard demanding to stop the construction of the housing project next to their homes. [size=no report]

On 17 January 2021, workers of the Jizzakh Petroleum oil refinery protested in the town of Tinchlik in Altyariq district of Fergana region against rumoured lay-offs, demanding the company preserve jobs, which refinery management representative denied indicating that salary cuts were in the planning due to slowdown of production. [size=no report]

On 17 January 2021, a male car driver was beaten by policemen following police stop due to traffic violation offence near the town of Chirakchi in Chirakchi of Kashkadarya region which victim disagreed with. According to the victim, the policemen without explanation took him out of the car and started to beat him. The driver was hospitalized with injuries.

On 16 January 2021, cab drivers gathered at the Department of Transportation in the town of Kasan in Kashkadarya region demanding the local authorities allow them to operate after coronavirus quarantine in the district. Protesters complained public buses can carry more than 5 passengers whereas taxi service was still restricted. [size=no report]

On 16 January 2021, farmers of Kizirik district in Surkhandarya region protested near the town of Sariq against the State Commission's preliminary work regarding farmers' complaints on the local authorities' plan to integrate protesters' farms into a cluster. Farmers demanded the Commission members address their concerns about financial losses that may follow if the original plan moves forward. [size=no report]

On 16 January 2021, female workers of the Jizzax Petroleum protested near the city of Fergana against looming mass lay-offs at the local factory demanding the authorities intervene to preserve their jobs. [size=no report]

On 15 January 2021, residents of demolished apartment buildings gathered in the town of Ohangaron in Tashkent region demanding compensation for their homes which private developer failed to provide, protesters complained. [size=no report]

On 15 January 2021, residents of the apartment buildings on Babur street in Yakkasaray district of Tashkent city protested outside their homes against the developer company, which failed to offer proper compensation for the houses, which were going to be demolished. The protesters demanded the city administration intervene in their dispute to settle the property ownership conflict. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2021, about 200 residents of Buyuk Turon neighbourhood in Karshi township of Kashkadarya region blocked the local road with chopped trees demonstrating against the townhall initiated the destruction of the local community park on 12 hectares of land where demonstrators planted trees, previously. Police detained three female demonstrators. [size=about 200]

On 13 January 2021, residents of the Kichkirik neighbourhood near Shaykhantokhur locality in Almazar district of Tashkent city protested against another attempt to launch construction of the housing project in their backyard. Protesters' demands were previously met after local district official intervened in the dispute which resulted in the stoppage of construction works. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2021, residents of the town of Altiarik in Altyariq district of Fergana region blocked the main road in protest against poor supply of natural gas to their households, demanding the authorities resolve the issue. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2021, about 50 car drivers gathered on Chorsu square in Namangan city in protest against liquified petroleum gas shortages in the city. Protesters complained gas stations were running out of fuel due to excessive demand which the authorities explained with technical issues involving supply infrastructure. [size=about 50]

On 12 January 2021, residents of the local neighbourhood next to high school 19 near Labzak locality in Shaykhantokhur district of Tashkent city protested outside their homes against illegal construction of the housing project in their backyard, demanding the developer company stop the activities. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, farmers of the Mingbuloq district in Namangan region protested in the town of Jomashoy against the monopoly of the local agricultural cluster on fertilizers demanding direct access to wholesale market prices from the local authorities. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, residents of Mergancha village in Urgut district of Samarkand region gathered outside their homes, demanding the local authorities provide natural gas to their homes which protesters complained the construction company failed to deliver prior to finishing project. [size=no report]

Around 12 January 2021, new homeowners protested near the local court in Navoi city calling for the city authorities to legalize their newly-built apartment building, as they had difficulties accessing utility and social services [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, residents of Sarapayon village near the town of Madaniy er in Khanka district of Khorezm region blocked the Urganch-Hazorasp motor road in protest of poor supply of natural gas to their homes demanding the district authorities fix the issue. [size=no report]

On 11 January 2021, female residents of Navbakhor neighbourhood near the town of Pakhtakor in Pakhtakor district of Jizzakh region blocked the nearby road in protest against poor supply of natural gas in the area, demanding the authorities fix the issue. [size=no report]

Around 10 January 2021, teachers of the Arts and Music school near the town of Goliblar in Arnasay district of Jizzakh region protested at the principal's office demanding their director remains in office. [size=no report]

On 9 January 2021, dozens of workers of the state-owned oil and gas construction company protested at the pipeline project near the town of Kasan in Kashkadarya region, demanding owed wages for months of work. Protesters called for the authorities to solve the issue with the unpaid labour at the company. [size=dozens]

On 7 January 2021, residents of the neighbourhood gathered at the local administration near the town of Chinoz in Chinaz district of Tashkent region demanding supply of natural gas to their households which protesters complained the authorities failed to do in time. [size=no report]

On 6 January 2021, residents of the Tashkent district protested at the abandoned facility of the former collective farm community near the town of Keles in Tashkent region demanding the district authorities provide court-ordered compensation for expropriation of the farm properties, which protesters complained the district administration hasn't done in eight years. Protesters called on the country's president to help them claim their compensation. [size=no report]

On 5 January 2021, farmers from Surkhandarya region gathered at the country's parliament in Tashkent city calling for the lawmakers to intervene in their dispute with the Kizirik district authorities that were pressuring and forcing farmers to sign up for the district administration's plan to create an agricultural cluster out of about five hundred farms of the district, which protesters disagreed with due to insufficiency of a business plan. [size=no report]

Around 5 January 2021, workers of a cotton farm protested near the town of Sardoba in Akaltyn district of Syrdarya region against upcoming layoffs and unsatisfactory wages demanding the company preserve jobs and pay raise. [size=no report]

On 4 January 2021, workers of a utility supply company gathered at the main office in Andizhan city demanding their wages which employees complained their management failed to provide on schedule. [size=no report]

On 4 January 2021, dozens of victims of an auto dealer protested outside the Bukhara regional court building in Bukhara city, demanding the authorities assist protesters with the recovery of their funds, which they paid to the company in exchange for new automobiles that they never received. Protesters complained the local authorities failed to provide legal aid to the victims. [size=dozens]

On 3 January 2021, farmers gathered near the town of Sariq in Kizirik district of Surkhandarya region demanding the local administration address their concerns regarding financial losses which may be inflicted upon if the authorities implement a business plan which would integrate the local farms of the district into an agricultural cluster. Protesters complained that district officials have ignored them for days which leaves them no option but seek assistance from the central government in the country' capital. [size=no report]

On 28 December 2020, female protesters blocked the local road outside the Mayor's Office in Kokand city in protest of lack of power and natural gas supplies, demanding utilities back on. [size=no report]

On 28 December 2020, residents of Tashkent city, Surkhandarya region, Samarkand city, Termez and Denov townships gathered outside the UN office in Tashkent city calling for UN to protect their private property ownership rights, which protesters complained were disregarded by the country's courts. [size=no report]

On 28 December 2020, residents of a neighbourhood in Davlatobot district of Namangan city protested outside their garages against the takeover of their properties and construction of the residential apartment building on location. [size=no report]

Around 27 December 2020, farmers gathered outside the local administration near the town of Sariq in Kizirik district of Surkhandarya region demanding more clarity regarding officials' plan to integrate protesters' farms into a cluster, which farmers complained left many of their concerns unanswered including business loans that protesters took out before the announcement. [size=no report]

On 27 December 2020, residents of the Oby Khayot neighbourhood near Halkobod township of Muzrabot district in Surkhandarya region blocked the local road and burned tires demonstrating against the lack of power supply in the area following an emergency on the supply end. [size=no report]

On 26 December 2020, residents of the local neighbourhood on Mukimi street in Chilanzar district of Tashkent city protested outside their homes blocking access to their backyard for the developer company demanding to stop construction activity. Protesters argued the construction work is illegal. [size=no report]

Around 25 December 2020, victims of a housing scheme gathered outside the residential apartment project construction site in Bukhara city, calling for the country's president to intervene in their case, which protesters complained was neglected by the local law enforcement agencies. [size=no report]

On 25 December 2020, residents of the Charkh kamolon-2 neighbourhood on Mukimi street in Chilanzar district of Tashkent city protested outside their homes against the attempted takeover of their backyard by a company, demanding its representatives provide official proof of land ownership. [size=no report]

On 24 December 2020, employees and children of an orphanage in the town of Buka of Buka district in Tashkent region protested on the premises against the dismissal of the orphanage director, demanding the local authorities reconsider their decision. [size=no report]

Around 23 December 2020, residents of the Kichkirik neighbourhood in Almazar district of Tashkent city protested near their homes against construction activity, demanding tp halt construction activity and workers leave the area. [size=no report]

On 23 December 2020, about 100 small retail business owners gathered at the Chilanzar district court in Tashkent city demanding a court annul the city administration's previous decree to transfer a shopping centre property land to a developers company. [size=about 100]

On 22 December 2020, a male resident was attacked by about 5 people in Jalakuduk town for recording the local farmers' market on his smartphone which he explained was done to learn about food prices in the area. Rioters mistakenly presumed the victim was recording traffic violations at the location. They forcefully placed the victim in the trunk of a car and took away his recording device. Police detained attackers later and the local district court fined offenders upon charging them with hooliganism offences. [size=about 5]

On 22 December 2020, victims of demolition drive and forced eviction protested at the office of Prosecutor General in Tashkent city, demanding the country's law enforcement agency protect their violated property ownership rights. [size=no report]

On 21 December 2020, victims of a housing scheme protested at the residential apartment building construction site in Bukhara city, demanding the country's government intervene in their dispute with the construction company and banks to save their unfinished homes from expropriation. Protesters complained they have invested in the apartment project years before the dispute. [size=no report]

On 21 December 2020, activists and city residents gathered outside the Adolat political party's headquarters in Tashkent city to support their candidate for the local district council, demanding their candidate in the party list for upcoming local council election. [size=no report]

On 19 December 2020, residents of Minor neighborhood in Yunusabad district of Tashkent city gathered in their backyard in protest of attempts by the construction company to build a residential housing development near their homes out of safety concerns. [size=no report]

On 17 December 2020, female retail business owners protested at the Beruni bazaar near Uchtepa locality of Shaykhantokhur district in Tashkent city against their shops' demolition, demanding the district authorities provide alternative space for their businesses and compensate for inflicted losses. [size=no report]

On 17 December 2020, female protesters blocked the local road in Nukus city demanding the city authorities pay owed wages, which officials promised to resolve during a meeting after the protest. [size=no report]

On 16 December 2020, a group of small business owners gathered outside the Uzbek government's administration in Tashkent city calling for the authorities to address their concerns regarding utilization fees for imported automobiles from abroad, which entrepreneurs complained is unreasonable. [size=no report]

Property destruction: On 16 December 2020, a personal automobile belonging to a local blogger was set on fire by an unknown individual in the city of Samarkand which prompted police investigation based on the destruction of property offence.

On 16 December 2020, dozens of Kavolot neighborhood residents blocked the local road near the town of Karmana in Karmana district of Navoi region, demanding the authorities turn the supply of natural gas and electricity back on. The company resumed utility supply following the protest. [size=dozens]

On 13 December 2020, retail shop owners gathered at the Beruni bazaar near Uchtepa locality of Shaykhantokhur district in Tashkent city to protest the demolition of their shops, calling for the authorities and the country's president to intervene and save their businesses. [size=no report]

On 11 December 2020, residents of Elobod neighborhood near Yashnobod locality of Mirzo Ulugbek district in Tashkent city protested in their backyard against illegal construction project within immediate proximity to their homes, demanding the authorities halt construction activity. [size=no report]

On 10 December 2020, residents of Hamdustlik neighborhood blocked the road at the intersection of Uzbekistan and Bobur streets in Andizhan city in protest of the lack of natural gas supply in the area, demanding the city authorities fix the issue. [size=no report]

On 9 December 2020, about 20 protesters blocked the M37 motor road near the town of Karakul in Qarakol district of Bukhara region, demanding a supply of natural gas to their homes amid the supply crisis in the country. [size=about 20]

On 9 December 2020, residents of Rabotipoyon village in Bukhara district of Bukhara region blocked the nearby freeway demanding the local authorities resume the supply of natural gas to residential homes following the supply crisis earlier. [size=no report]

On 9 December 2020, victims of the employment scheme gathered outside the local court in Nukus city demanding their funds back from suspects whom protesters accused of organizing fraudulent activity with a promise of jobs in the European Union countries for which victims paid substantial fees. [size=no report]

On 8 December 2020, dozens of construction company workers protested at the Uzbekistan GTL plant site near Guzar township in Kashkadarya region, demanding wages for two months of work, which protesters complained the company failed to pay on time. [size=dozens]

On 6 December 2020, residents of the Istikbol neighborhood in Karakamysh locality of Almazar district in Tashkent city protested outside their homes against the construction of the residential apartment building in their backyard. [size=no report]

On 3 December 2020, residents of the local neighborhood in Nukus city of Karakalpakstan region in Uzbekistan gathered near their homes, demanding natural gas supply to their households. Protesters indicated that the local authorities promised to resolve the issue. [size=no report]

On 2 December 2020, about 80 drivers of the municipal bus company protested at the terminal in the town of Karshi of Kashkadarya region, demanding owed wages for up to a year and improvement of working conditions. [size=about 80]

On 30 November 2020, farmers and their supporters, including relatives, protested on their cropland in the village of Uchkulach of Forish district in Jizzakh region against the takeover of agricultural land by the councilman with help from the local administration official. Protesters appealed to the country's president for intervention in the case. [size=no report]

On 30 November 2020, about 50 victims of Sardoba water dam disaster gathered outside the Uzbek government's administration in Tashkent city, demanding the country's authorities provide them with housing. Protesters complained they are homeless since May 2020. [size=about 50]

Around 28 November 2020, local neighborhood residents gathered near their homes in the town of Chinoz in Tashkent region, demanding the authorities provide natural gas supply to their households. [size=no report]

On 27 November 2020, about 20 female protesters gathered at the local park near Buyuk Turon neighborhood of Karshi township in Kashkadarya region, demanding the town administration preserve trees from removal out of environmental concerns. Protesters complained of air pollution in the area where the park is the only location with less polluted air. [size=about 20]

On 26 November 2020, residents of the Damaryk neighborhood in Yakkasaray district of Tashkent city protested outside their homes against the demolition of their properties, demanding the city authorities protect their rights and properties. [size=no report]

On 25 November 2020, residents of Tashkent city protested outside the Korean Cultural Center, demanding access to the country's Prosecutor General, who was reportedly planned to have an open session with the local public at the location. Protesters raised multiple issues, including forced eviction and bureaucracy in the government. [size=no report]

On 25 November 2020, residents of Pitnak village in Tuprokkalya district of Khorezm region protested near their homes, demanding the regional authorities deliver better roads, access to drinking water and jobs in the area. [size=no report]

On 25 November 2020, residents of the local neighborhood on Mukimi street in Chilanzar district of Tashkent city protested against illegal construction work in their backyard, demanding to stop the activity. [size=no report]

On 24 November 2020, residents of Dustlik neighborhood protested outside the local administration's office near the town of Toshloq in Toshlok district of Fergana region, demanding natural gas and power supply after an emergency with supply in the area. [size=no report]

On 23 November 2020, residents of the local neighborhood in Yakkasaray locality of Tashkent city protested in the nearby park against the planned construction of a diner in the area, demanding the city authorities intervene to save the park from destruction. [size=no report]

On 22 November 2020, 50-60 residents of Guzar township in Kashkadarya region protested outside the Guzar district power supply company's office demanding electricity supply after a power outage in town. [size=50-60]

Around 20 November 2020, residents of Aviasozlar neighborhood near Mirabad locality of Yashnobod district in Tashkent city gathered outside their homes in protest of allegedly illegal construction of a commercial building in their backyard, demanding the local administration cancel the project. [size=no report]

On 17 November 2020, residents of the 19th quartal in Yunusabad district of Tashkent city protested outside the construction site of the residential apartment building, demanding the city authorities cancel the project due to safety concerns in the neighborhood. [size=no report]

Around 13 November 2020, about 8 construction workers protested near the Tashkent regional state administration's office in Nurafshon township demanding backpay for 3 months of labor work in Syrdaryo region's Okoltin district following Sardoba dam break in May 2020. [size=about 8]

On 11 November 2020, 3 female residents of Kashkadarya region were beaten by policemen in the townhall of Karshi township after attempting to meet with local officials and discuss their grievances. Women were detained and later placed in detention for alleged hooliganism.

On 11 November 2020, residents of Qubdin Shoikhuja neighborhood in the town of Karshi of Kashkadarya region protested near their homes against the lack of natural gas supply, demanding the district administration provide gas utility in the area. [size=no report]

On 7 November 2020, residents of Biy neighborhood on Sayram street near Yashnobod locality in Mirzo Ulugbek district of Tashkent city protested in their backyard against the commercial's construction development by the contractor company near their homes, demanding halt to demolition activity. [size=no report]

Around 5 November 2020, members of the summer house community in Charvak township of Bostanlik district in Tashkent region protested near their properties against the construction of the hotel project in the area calling for the country's authorities to intervene out of environmental concerns. [size=no report]

On 5 November 2020, residents of the Chah kamolon-2 neighborhood in Chilanzar locality of Tashkent city protested against the allegedly illegal takeover of their backyard by the construction company demanding the city authorities cancel the construction project in the area. [size=no report]

On 1 November 2020, residents of a neighborhood near Shaykhantokhur locality of Almazar district in Tashkent city protested outside the pre-school education facility 478 against the construction of the production facility in the area, demanding to stop the project activity. [size=no report]

On 1 November 2020, residents of Karakamysh in Almazar district of Tashkent city protested against allegedly an illegal construction project in the area, demanding to stop demolition activity. [size=no report]

On 30 October 2020, residents of a neighborhood near Bektemir locality of Yashnobod district in Tashkent city protested outside their homes against allegedly illegal construction of the multi-story apartment building in their backyard, calling for the district authorities to probe the project. [size=no report]

On 28 October 2020, residents of the local neighborhood in Uchtepa locality of Tashkent city protested against an illegal construction project in their backyard, demanding the district administration demolish the unsanctioned project. [size=no report]

On 26 October 2020, city residents protested outside the state regional administration's office in Andizhan city against a lack of social support amid rising food and coal prices, demanding the local authorities assist the socially vulnerable households. [size=no report]

On 25 October 2020, private homeowners in Dam aryk neighborhood protested outside their properties in Yakkasaray locality of Tashkent city against the demolition of their houses by the developer company demanding the city authorities halt construction activity until private property owners will settle a dispute with the company. [size=no report]
On 23 October 2020, a journalist was physically attacked with a truncheon by police officers in Tashkent city after a dispute over a possible violation of traffic regulation by the journalist.

On 23 October 2020, volunteers of the coronavirus quarantine facility in Uchtepa locality of Tashkent city protested against their dismissal from job positions demanding facility management provide official reasons, which protesters argued weren't disclosed to them. [size=no report]

On 22 October 2020, dozens of students protested outside the state education testing agency's office in Tashkent city against the unfair admission process for students with above-average test scores demanding the education agency revise their scholarship applications. [size=dozens]

On 22 October 2020, farmers gathered on their land near the town of Turakurgan in Turakorgon district of Namangan region, demanding the local authorities provide irrigation water to their farms. Protesters appealed to the Uzbek president for assistance with their concerns. [size=no report]

On 21 October 2020, a demonstration of about 5000 workers of Enter Engineering turned violent at the construction site of the GTL plant in the village of Shortan of Guzar district in Kashkadarya region after a labor dispute over unpaid wages. The Uzbek authorities dispatched National Guard and riot police units to maintain order at the plant. The company denied having delays with pay. [size=about 5000]

On 21 October 2020, residents of Kichkirik neighborhood near Shaykhantokhur locality in Almazar district of Tashkent city protested against illegal attempts to build a multi-story apartment building in their backyard, demanding the city authorities intervene to resolve the dispute. [size=no report]

On 18 October 2020, residents of the local neighborhood on Azimov street near Mirabad locality in Yashnobod district of Tashkent city protested against residential apartment building construction demanding the city authorities intervene to preserve the nearby green zone. [size=no report]

On 17 October 2020, residents of the local neighborhood in Namangan city protested against the construction of the multi-storey apartment building next to their homes, demanding the company unblock access to outbound roads, which is restricting access for emergency services in the area. [size=no report]

On 16 October 2020, about 10 residents of the Karasu-2 neighborhood near Karasu-4 locality in Mirzo Ulugbek district of Tashkent city protested near their garages that are contested by the developer company demanding the district administration shut down the construction project due to the illegal status of the company's permits and approval papers. [size=about 10]

On 12 October 2020, about 50 victims of Korean and Migrations firm demonstrated on Mustakillik square in Tashkent city the location demanding the Uzbek government recover their funds. The police detained at least 1 protester. [size=about 50]

On 12 October 2020, 5-10 residents of Navruz neighborhood near Mirabad section of Yashnobod district in Tashkent city protested against the construction of the gasoline and LNG supply stations close to their homes, demanding the authorities resolve their concerns. [size=5-10]

On 12 October 2020, drivers of a taxi company gathered at a cab garage in the town of Konimex of Kanimekh district in Navoi region demanding the authorities lift coronavirus restrictions on taxi businesses in the region and allow them to carry up to several passengers per trip. Protesters complained they can't pay taxes due to lack of work since the beginning of lockdown in March 2020 and appealed to the country's president for assistance. [size=no report]

Around 11 October 2020, about 10 female small produce retail business owners gathered near the local bazaar in Denov township of Denov district in Surkhandarya regon demanding the authorities reopen their shops after months of coronavirus quarantine restrictions imposed on them and appealing to the country's president for help. [size=about 10]

On 7 October 2020, a group of rioters physically attacked and assaulted an Uzbek journalist near the town of Chirchiq in Tashkent region after the victim started recording attackers in the process of cutting trees. [size=no report]

On 7 October 2020, 5-10 residents of the Kichkirik neighborhood near Shaykhantokhur locality in Almazar district of Tashkent city protested against the takeover of their backyard by the developer company representatives calling for help from the city authorities to settle the land dispute. [size=5-10]

On 6 October 2020, about 10 victims of the employment firm gathered at the state migration agency in Tashkent city, demanding the authorities assist protesters with the recovery of their funds from the scheme organizers. [size=about 10]

On 5 October 2020, demonstrators started rioting at the local farm in Joyilma village (Shurchi district, Surkhandarya region) during a demonstration over a land property dispute between a landowner and a farmer. A verbal exchange turned into a physical confrontation with farmer supporters throwing bricks and stones at the opposite side. One person was injured and hospitalized. [size=no report]

On 5 October 2020, students and their parents protested outside the state testing center in Tashkent city demanding the education authorities consider the military service records during the admission to the university, which protesters complained wasn't done. [size=no report]

On 5 October 2020, about 10 residents of the local neighborhood on Mukimi street near Yashnobod locality in Mirzo Ulugbek district of Tashkent city protested against alleged illegal construction activity in their backyard, demanding the company halt its work project. [size=about 10]

On 3 October 2020, about 30 policemen attempted to disperse a protest of 8 Sardoba dam victims outside the Uzbek government's main office in Tashkent city, who insisted on a meeting with the country's Prime-Minister to discuss compensation for damaged properties during flooding in May 2020. [size=about 8]

On 2 October 2020, retail shop owners protested at the local bazaar in the town of Shakhrixan in Andijan region against the eviction of their businesses by bailiffs and police claiming the illegal nature of forced removal. [size=no report]

On 1 October 2020, about 8 victims of the Sardoba dam break gathered outside the country's government's administration in Tashkent city, demanding a meeting with the Prime-Minister to discuss compensation for their destroyed homes which they haven't received. [size=about 8]

On 1 October 2020, 10-15 residents of the Chilanzar neighborhood on Mukimiy street in Tashkent city blocked access to the construction company equipment and trucks to allegedly illegally expropriated land plot next to their apartment buildings demanding cancellation of the project. [size=10-15]

Around 29 September 2020, about 10 residents of the Sharq Yulduz neighborhood near Nurobod township in Nurobod district of Samarkand region gathered near their homes demanding the authorities recover the local soccer field for their children which was allegedly leased to the businesses by the school director. [size=about 10]

Around 29 September 2020, about 4 residents of Tuprokkalya district protested close to their homes near the town of Pitnak in Khorezm region against the takeover of the local land plot by a businessman demanding the authorities recover it for its original purpose and appealing to the country's government for intervention. The land initially was designated for a school. [size=about 4]

On 29 September 2020, 10-15 residents of the Chilanzar neighborhood in Tashkent city protested against the nearby construction project demanding the local administration shut down the project due to safety concerns. [size=10-15]
